result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessie Lee Haggard Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.
  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of extended supervision or civil judgment.
Concurrent with: to count 3 and consecutive to current sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain GED/HSED.
Obtain and maintain employment.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No contact with victim, Tiara F., wthout court approval.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

 AS TO COUNT #2 (w/o habitual repeater) the Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS (CONCURRENT to count #3 and CONSECUTIVE to current sentence), with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.   

 AS TO COUNT #3 (w/o habitual repeater) the Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS (CONCURRENT to count #2 and CONSECUTIVE to current sentence), with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:   
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Tiara F., without court approval.    
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
 Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.   
Memoradum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.   mld

Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered that the habitual repeater (939.62(1)(a), are dismissed on both COUNTS #2 and #3.  
 Only the Domestic Abuse Repeater 939.621(1)(b)&(2) remains.  

 AS TO COUNTS #2 and #3 (w/o habitual repeater), defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-13-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Robert E Haney in court, defendant Jessie Lee Haggard not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-23-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Court took judicial notice of the certified documents attached to the criminal complaint, that shows that the dv surcharge was waived on both cases 2010CM391 and 2010CM2018.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer David Vettin.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-30-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tiara F or her children

Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Jessie Lee Haggard in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
